meanings.definition: Capable of being reclaimed or recovered.
meanings.sent1: The old furniture was reclaimable with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The recyclable materials were easily reclaimable for future use.
meanings.sent3: The lost toy was reclaimable from the bottom of the toy chest.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like a reclaimable treasure, waiting to be rediscovered.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood are reclaimable through old photographs.

meanings.definition: Able to be reused or recycled.
meanings.sent1: The reclaimable glass bottles were collected for recycling.
meanings.sent2: The cardboard boxes were easily reclaimable for packaging purposes.
meanings.sent3: The old clothes were reclaimable for a fun DIY project.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a reclaimable quality that never lost its value.
meanings.sent5: The recyclable materials were reclaimable resources for the community.

meanings.definition: That can be restored to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The antique clock was reclaimable after a careful restoration.
meanings.sent2: The old house was reclaimable with some renovation work.
meanings.sent3: The broken vase was reclaimable with a skilled repair job.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in him was like a reclaimable bond, stronger after each challenge.
meanings.sent5: The neglected garden was reclaimable with some love and attention.
